description: Numbers n such that 2^n-9 is prime.
comments: Except the first term 4, all terms are odd since 2^(2*m)-9 = (2^m-3) * (2^m+3) is not prime for m>2.
example: 243 is in the sequence because 2^243-9 is prime.
author: _Andrey V. Kulsha_, Feb 02 2001
extensions: a(24)-a(25) from Max Alekseyev, a(26)-a(27) from Paul Underwood, added by _Max Alekseyev_, Feb 09 2012
